result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin Joseph Kiehm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 5 (FIVE) days served.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

records.addlTxt:
**CASE RECALLED FOR SENTENCING AT 11:30**

Defendant Colin Joseph Kiehm in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing by the State, Defense and the Defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 (FOUR) MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 5 (FIVE) days served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 (FIFTEEN) MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
WCS Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Colin Joseph Kiehm in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State reports that Defendant has had multiple violations since the 08-03-2015 hearing.  State advises the Court that based upon the multiple violations they will be seeking to revoke the DPA.  Defense reports that Defendant has completed some Community Service at St. Vincent DePaul but does NOT have any proof.  Defense requests that matter NOT be revoked at this time.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Court PASSES case for Sentencing.  Defendant is remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending Sentencing.
Review hearing on October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court is now down 10-01-2015.  Review hearing scheduled for 10-13-2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Attorney Schwarz notified by email.  cmt

Defendant Colin Joseph Kiehm in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
 Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be deferred.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement signed, reviewed, received and filed. Case calendared for REVIEW HEARING on 8/3/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 33, Judge Ashley.

Defendant Colin Joseph Kiehm in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Deferred prosecution hearing.  Defense counsel requests new date.   Case adjourned for Deferred prosecution hearing in Branch 15.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Colin Joseph Kiehm in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant missed his TAD evaluation. Case rescheduled for Deferred Prosecution on 5/21/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Colin Joseph Kiehm in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for Deferred Prosecution on 4/29/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Colin Joseph Kiehm in court with James Bowers practicing under the student practice rule under the supervision of attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Paul Hauer for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Colin Joseph Kiehm in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/9/15 @ 1:30 pm
